info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:07PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Robeson, north central Florence, Dillon, Darlington, northern Marion and Marlboro Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 206 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Swift Creek to near Mechanicsville to Sellers to near Rains. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bennettsville, Hartsville, Marion, Dillon, Darlington, Mullins, Fairmont, Mccoll, Latta, Rowland, Quinby, Lake View, Clio, Sellers, Blue Brick, Hamer, Brownsville, Darlington Raceway, Swift Creek and Rains. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 near mile marker 130. Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 164 and 198. Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
